intro: Astragalus octopus, commonly known as the octopus milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, harsh environments. Astragalus octopus has small, rounded pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
